content:
TITLE: Running Linear CLI Import Tool
DESCRIPTION: Command to run the interactive importer after installation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/linear/linear/blob/master/packages/import/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
linear-import
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing and Building Linear API Packages
DESCRIPTION: Commands for setting up the Linear API development environment. Includes steps for installing dependencies, building packages, running tests, updating schema, and creating changesets.
SOURCE: https://github.com/linear/linear/blob/master/packages/sdk/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
# install dependencies
yarn

# build all packages
yarn build

# test all packages
yarn test

# update the schema from the production API
yarn schema

# create changeset for generating CHANGELOG.md
yarn changeset
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing and Building Linear SDK Dependencies
DESCRIPTION: Commands for setting up the Linear SDK development environment. Includes installing dependencies, building packages, running tests, updating schema and creating changelogs using yarn.
SOURCE: https://github.com/linear/linear/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
# install dependencies
yarn

# build all packages
yarn build

# test all packages
yarn test

# update the schema from the production API
yarn schema

# create changeset for generating CHANGELOG.md
yarn changeset
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Linear CLI Import Tool with Yarn
DESCRIPTION: Command to install the Linear CLI import tool globally using Yarn package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/linear/linear/blob/master/packages/import/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
yarn global add @linear/import
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Linear CLI Import Tool with NPM
DESCRIPTION: Command to install the Linear CLI import tool globally using NPM package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/linear/linear/blob/master/packages/import/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm i --location=global @linear/import
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Next.js Development Server for Linear File Upload
DESCRIPTION: Commands to navigate to the project directory and start the Next.js development server. This allows you to run and test the Linear file upload functionality locally.
SOURCE: https://github.com/linear/linear/blob/master/examples/nextjs-file-upload/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
cd nextjs-file-upload
yarn dev
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Linear API Key in Next.js
DESCRIPTION: Instructions for setting up the Linear API key in the Next.js environment. This involves renaming a file and adding the API key to the environment variables.
SOURCE: https://github.com/linear/linear/blob/master/examples/nextjs-file-upload/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
# Rename .env.local.example â†’ .env.local
LINEAR_API_KEY="YOUR_API_KEY"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Handling Issue Creation Rate Limit
DESCRIPTION: Implements handling for the 'issueCreate' rate limit during imports in the Linear CLI.
SOURCE: https://github.com/linear/linear/blob/master/packages/import/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-23_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:


----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating Next.js App for Linear File Upload
DESCRIPTION: Command to bootstrap a Next.js application using create-next-app, specifically for the Linear file upload example. This sets up the project structure and initial files.
SOURCE: https://github.com/linear/linear/blob/master/examples/nextjs-file-upload/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
yarn create next-app --example https://github.com/linear/linear/tree/master/examples/nextjs-file-upload nextjs-file-upload
```

TITLE: Markdown File Structure for Linear Codegen Documentation
DESCRIPTION: Main documentation file explaining the purpose, output, and flow of the Linear code generator plugin. Details how fragments and operations are generated from the GraphQL schema.
SOURCE: https://github.com/linear/linear/blob/master/packages/codegen-doc/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
# Linear Codegen Document

This custom [graphql-code-generator](https://graphql-code-generator.com/) plugin takes the Linear GraphQL [schema](../sdk/src/schema.graphql) and generates GraphQL [fragments and operations](../sdk/src/_generated_documents.graphql). 

Usage in [codegen.doc.yml](../sdk/codegen.doc.yml).

## Output

The [@linear/sdk](../sdk/README.md) uses this code generator [plugin](./src/plugin.ts) to generate:

A fragment for each model in the Linear API containing:
- all scalar fields on the model
- required fields for any nested object with a matching query
- fragment spreads for any nested object with no matching query

An operation for each query and mutation in the Linear API containing:
- all available variables
- fragment spread for the matching model

An operation for each nested query within a model containing:
- all available variables for both the root and child query
- fragment spread for the matching child model
- a query name joining the root and child query fields (eg `query user_assignedIssues`)

## Flow

1. The GraphQL schema is parsed using a reusable [ContextVisitor](./src/context-visitor.ts) to provide consistent information across the Linear code generator plugins
2. The context is visited using the [FragmentVisitor](./src/fragment-visitor.ts) to return a list of printed GraphQL fragments
3. The fragments and context are visited using the [OperationVisitor](./src/operation-visitor.ts) to return a list of printed GraphQL operations
4. The printed fragments and operations are returned to be printed
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Workflow Description in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: Outlines the 5-step flow of how the GraphQL schema is processed and converted into tests. Includes parsing the schema, visiting models, parsing operations, and generating test output.
SOURCE: https://github.com/linear/linear/blob/master/packages/codegen-test/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
1. The GraphQL schema is parsed using a reusable [ContextVisitor](../codegen-doc/src/context-visitor.ts) to provide consistent information across the Linear code generator plugins
2. The context is visited using the [ModelVisitor](../codegen-sdk/src/model-visitor.ts) to return a list of parsed Linear models
3. The models and context are [parsed](../codegen-sdk/src/parse-operation.ts) to return a map of all operations for each nested resource
4. The parsed models, operations and context are used to print [tests](./src/print-test.ts)
5. The printed tests are returned to be printed
```
